meanings.definition: Form an opinion before possessing full information or experience.
meanings.sent1: She preconceived his personality based on rumors.
meanings.sent2: I preconceive my reaction to scary movies before watching them.
meanings.sent3: Don't preconceive the ending of the book; it might surprise you!
meanings.sent4: Her preconceived notions about spiders made her scream at the sight of a tiny one.
meanings.sent5: Try not to preconceive people's intentions; they might have good reasons for their actions.

meanings.definition: To conceive or form an idea beforehand.
meanings.sent1: He preconceives his speeches to ensure they are impactful.
meanings.sent2: She preconceives her art projects before starting to sketch.
meanings.sent3: The chef preconceived a new recipe in his dream last night.
meanings.sent4: The inventor preconceived a groundbreaking invention while daydreaming.
meanings.sent5: Try to preconceive your goals before taking action; it helps with planning.
